1mOHPPXqOeVwu6cHYgEC.title: Nordic Storm Forstærker Truppen med Tre Nye Signeringer på Fire Dage
1mOHPPXqOeVwu6cHYgEC.titleEn: Nordic Storm Bolsters Roster with Three New Signings in Four Days

parts.html: Nordic Storm, den nyeste tilføjelse til European League of Football, har ikke spildt tiden med at styrke deres lineup. I en hektisk uge med annonceringer har holdet afsløret tre nye signeringer på kun fire dage, hver med unikke talenter og energi til truppen.

Første Signering: Chad Walrond Bringer Hurtighed og Smidighed som Safety/Kick Returner


Mandag præsenterede Nordic Storm deres første signering i ugen, nummer 3, Chad Walrond, en Safety og Kick Returner med en imponerende sportsbaggrund. Oprindeligt fra Bridgetown, Barbados, og nu bosiddende i London, har Walrond spillet football siden 2017, hvor han startede på Hertfordshire University. Han fortsatte med at repræsentere Storbritannien i 2019, før han flyttede til den tyske liga i 2021. Siden da har han spillet for Istanbul Rams, Cologne Centurions og Stuttgart Surge, hvor han har finpudset sine færdigheder og opbygget et ry som en dynamisk spiller i Europa.


Walronds erfaring både i forsvaret og på special teams gør ham til en alsidig styrke for Storm. Hans eksplosive hurtighed og evne til at læse spillet forventes at give holdet en ekstra fordel. Med udsigt til den kommende sæson delte Walrond sin begejstring:


“Jeg håber virkelig, at I alle er klar og spændte. Vi har ikke planer om at starte langsomt, men vi får brug for energien fra hver eneste af jer for at hjælpe os med at opnå storhed. Tak Jah. Altid. Go Storm!"

Forstærkning af Centret: Joachim Christensen Slutter Sig til som Nummer 75


Dagen efter annoncerede Storm deres anden signering: nummer 75, Joachim Christensen, som vil spille Center. Kendt for sin stærke tilstedeværelse på den offensive linje er Christensens CV et vidnesbyrd om hans indflydelse i ligaen. Oprindeligt fra Brøndby, København, har han en imponerende karriere og har været en nøglespiller for hold i hele Europa. For nylig spillede han for Rhein Fire og hjalp dem med at sikre ELF-mesterskabet i 2023, og før det stod han i spidsen for Frankfurt Galaxy’s offensive linje, hvor han ledte dem til ELF-mesterskabet i 2021.


Efter en kort pause fra football vender Christensen nu tilbage med fornyet fokus og bringer sin omfattende erfaring og sine færdigheder til Storm. Hans præstationer inkluderer flere ELF All-Star udvælgelser, en titel som AFI All-Europe First Team Center i 2021 og 2022 og adskillige danske mesterskaber. Med sin lederskabsevne og taktiske forståelse vil Christensen være en central figur i Storms angreb.


Christensen er ivrig efter at bringe sin “nordiske ånd og bersærker-mentalitet” til holdet og udtaler:


“Modstandere søg ly. Jeg er tilbage for at være en del af et stærkt football-program og mission. Det eneste mål er at vinde i Europa med nordisk ånd og bersærker-mentalitet. Let's go Storm!"

parts.imageText: Max Parkinson - Defensive Tackle, Defensive End

parts.html:
Max Parkinson Kompletterer Trioen med Styrke på Den Defensive Linje

﻿

Afslutningsvis bød Storm velkommen til Max Parkinson, en ung og lovende defensiv linjespiller, torsdag. Parkinson, kun 23 år gammel, har vist en bemærkelsesværdig fysisk styrke og hurtig udvikling, siden han begyndte at spille football i efteråret 2022. Fra Croydon i Storbritannien gjorde Parkinson hurtigt indtryk og blev en del af CFL’s Saskatchewan Roughriders træningshold efter kun ni kampe på University of the West of England (UWE) i Bristol. For at opnå erfaring blev han sendt til Regina Thunder, hvor han opnåede 23 tacklinger, 7 tackles for tab og 3 sacks på kun otte kampe.


Ved 2023 CFL Global Combine demonstrerede Parkinson imponerende atletiske evner, hvor han førte alle deltagere (både globale og nationale) med 29 gentagelser på 225-pund bænkpres og løb 40-yard dash på 4,74 sekunder – hurtigst blandt de defensive linjefolk. Med sin højde på 190 cm og en vægt på 110 kg kombinerer Parkinson styrke og hastighed, hvilket vil være en stor fordel for Storms defensive linje, hvor han vil fokusere på at presse modstanderens quarterbacks og kontrollere linjen.

partsEn.html: Nordic Storm, the newest addition to the European League of Football, has wasted no time in strengthening their lineup. In a whirlwind week of announcements, the team revealed three new signings over just four days, each bringing unique talents and energy to the roster.

First Up: Chad Walrond Brings Speed and Agility as Safety/Kick Returner


On Monday, Nordic Storm introduced their first signing of the week, number 3, Chad Walrond, a Safety and Kick Returner with an impressive athletic background. Originally from Bridgetown, Barbados, and currently based in London, Walrond has played football since 2017, starting at Hertfordshire University. He went on to represent Great Britain in 2019, before moving to the German Football League in 2021. Since then, he has played with the Istanbul Rams, Cologne Centurions, and Stuttgart Surge, refining his skills and building a reputation as a dynamic player in Europe.


Walrond’s experience on both defense and special teams makes him a versatile asset for the Storm. His explosive speed and field awareness are expected to bring an extra edge to the team. Reflecting on the upcoming season, Walrond shared his excitement:


“I really hope that you’re all ready and excited. We do not plan on starting slow, but we’re going to need the energy from every single one of you to help us achieve greatness. Thanks Jah. Always. Go Storm!"

Strengthening the Center: Joachim Christensen Joins as Number 75

﻿

The following day, the Storm announced their second signing: number 75, Joachim Christensen, who will play Center. Known for his powerful presence on the offensive line, Christensen’s resume is a testament to his impact in the league. Originally from Brøndby, Copenhagen, he boasts an illustrious career, having been a key player for teams across Europe. Most recently, he played for Rhein Fire, helping them secure the ELF Championship in 2023, and prior to that, he anchored the offensive line for Frankfurt Galaxy, leading them to the 2021 ELF Championship.


After briefly stepping away from football, Christensen returns with renewed focus, bringing his extensive experience and skill to the Storm. His accolades include multiple ELF All-Star selections, a title as AFI All-Europe First Team at Center in 2021 and 2022, and numerous Danish championships. With his leadership and tactical awareness, Christensen will be a central figure in the Storm's offense.


Christensen is eager to bring his “northern spirit and berserker mindset” to the team, declaring:


“Opponents seek shelter. I’m back to be a part of a strong football program and mission. The only goal is to win in Europe with the northern spirit and berserker mindset. Let’s go Storm!”

partsEn.imageText: Max Parkinson - Defensive Tackle, Defensive End

partsEn.html:
Max Parkinson Rounds Out the Trio with Defensive Line Power


Rounding off the trio of signings, the Storm welcomed Max Parkinson, a young and promising Defensive Lineman, on Thursday. At just 23 years old, Parkinson has shown remarkable physical prowess and rapid development since he began playing football in late 2022. From Croydon in the UK, Parkinson made an impact quickly, joining the CFL’s Saskatchewan Roughriders practice squad after only nine games at the University of the West of England (UWE) in Bristol. To gain experience, he was assigned to Regina Thunder, where he recorded 23 tackles, 7 tackles for loss, and 3 sacks in just eight games.

﻿

At the 2023 CFL Global Combine, Parkinson demonstrated impressive athletic ability, leading all participants with 29 reps on the 225-pound bench press and clocking 4.74 seconds in the 40-yard dash—making him the fastest among defensive linemen. Standing at 6’3” and weighing 242 lbs, Parkinson’s combination of strength and speed will be a major asset to the Storm’s defensive line, where he will focus on pressuring quarterbacks and controlling the line of scrimmage.

2Bectt1ePmgsYdDdlxTx.titleEn: Exavier Edwards Joins Nordic Storm: A Major Signing for ELF's Newest Team

parts.html: Nordic Storm, det nyeste hold i European League of Football (ELF), har fået endnu en stor underskrift i Exavier Edwards, en tidligere ELF All-Star og mester. Edwards, kendt for sin alsidighed og lederevner, bliver en nøglefigur i storms defence og special teams, når han slutter sig til holdet efter tre succesfulde sæsoner med Vienna Vikings.

Mester, All-Star og Playmaker

Edwards bringer en imponerende karriere til København. Han var en afgørende del af Vienna Vikings' ELF-mesterskab i 2022 og blev udnævnt til ELF All-Star i 2023. Over tre sæsoner med Vikings stod Edwards for 111 tacklinger og 9 interceptions, samtidig med at han bidrog væsentligt på special teams med 1.633 return yards og en touchdown. Hans evne til også at spille offensivt resulterede i fem rushing touchdowns, hvilket viser hans alsidighed og værdi som en game-changer.

I 2024 kæmpede Edwards med skader, der begrænsede ham til kun fem kampe. Trods dette leverede han 19 tacklinger, én interception og 274 return yards, hvilket beviser hans modstandsdygtighed og beslutsomhed. Nu er han klar til at bringe sine dynamiske evner til Nordic Storm og begynde et nyt kapitel med ELF's nyeste hold.

En Alsidig Karriere, Skabt til Succes

Edwards' karriere fremhæver hans alsidighed både på og uden for banen. Før sin tid i Vienna spillede han for Braunschweig New Yorker Lions i den tyske football-liga (GFL) i 2021, hvor han imponerede som både running back og safety. I den sæson opnåede han 1.144 all-purpose yards og scorede 11 touchdowns, samtidig med at han bidrog på forsvaret med to sacks og en forceret fumble. Hans unikke evne til at påvirke spillet fra flere positioner gør ham til en værdifuld spiller for ethvert hold.

Fra sine college-dage som All-Conference safety og return-specialist på Midland University til sin succes i Europa har Edwards konsekvent bevist sig som en leder og en afgørende spiller.

partsEn.html: The Nordic Storm, the latest addition to the European League of Football (ELF), have made a huge signing in Exavier Edwards, a former ELF All-Star and Champion. Edwards, known for his versatility and leadership, will be a key figure in the Storm defence and special teams, joining the team after a successful three-season stint with the Vienna Vikings.

Champion, All-Star, and Playmaker

Edwards brings a decorated resume to Copenhagen. A crucial part of the Vienna Vikings’ 2022 ELF Championship-winning team, he was named an ELF All-Star in 2023. Over three seasons with the Vikings, Edwards recorded 111 tackles and 9 interceptions, while also contributing significantly on special teams with 1,633 return yards and one touchdown. His ability to line up on offense led to five rushing touchdowns, demonstrating his versatility and value as a game-changer.

In 2024, Edwards battled injuries that limited him to just five games. Despite this, he managed 19 tackles, one interception, and 274 return yards, proving his resilience and determination. Now, he’s ready to bring his dynamic skillset to the Nordic Storm as he embarks on a new chapter with the league's newest franchise.

A Versatile Career, Built for Success

Edwards’ career highlights his versatility on and off the field. Before his time in Vienna, he played for the Braunschweig New Yorker Lions in the German Football League (GFL) in 2021, where he shone as both a running back and safety. That season, he tallied 1,144 all-purpose yards and scored 11 touchdowns while also contributing on defense with two sacks and a forced fumble. His unique ability to impact the game from multiple positions makes him a valuable asset for any team.

From his college days as an All-Conference safety and return man at Midland University to his success in Europe, Edwards has consistently proven himself as a leader and playmaker.

parts.html:
Stephen Schueler slutter sig til Nordic Storm som medejer og bestyrelsesmedlem

København, Danmark – 25. april 2025

Nordic Storm, Danmarks nye førende amerikanske fodboldhold, kan med stolthed

annoncere udnævnelsen af Stephen Schueler som medejer og bestyrelsesmedlem.

Schueler bringer et væld af international ledererfaring og et enormt engagement i at

fremme amerikansk-danske relationer.

I skrivende stund fungerer han som Administrerende Direktør for Enerjen Capital, et

markedsførende selskab inden for vedvarende energi med speciale i den maritime

sektor. Schueler har tidligere haft ledende roller som Chief Commercial Officer hos

A.P. Møller-Maersk Group, som Corporate Vice President hos Microsoft Corporation

og brugt over to årtier hos Procter & Gamble med ansvaret for globale

detailvirksomheder.

Ud over sine erhvervsmæssige udmærkelser er Schueler præsident for The

American Club i Danmark, en organisation dedikeret til at styrke kulturelle og

forretningsmæssige bånd mellem USA og Danmark. Hans specielle forhold til

Danmark understreges yderligere ved sin oldefar, Dr. Michael Cramer, der tjente

som USA's ambassadør i Danmark fra 1870 til 1881 og i Schweiz fra 1881 til 1885.

Dr. Cramer var oprindeligt fra Ohio, og hans diplomatiske arbejde lagde grundlaget

for Schuelers langvarige forpligtelse til den amerikanske og danske relation. Mere

information kan findes på The American Club.

"Jeg er beæret over at slutte mig til Nordic Storm og bidrage til udviklingen af

amerikansk fodbold i Danmark," siger Schueler. "Denne mulighed kombinerer min

passion for sport, lederskab og min stærke personlige forbindelse til Danmark. " Jeg

er spændt over at være med til at bygge noget helt særligt med Nordic Storm."

Nordic Storm spiller sin første kamp d. 18. maj i Schweiz og deres længe ventede

første hjemmekamp i København den 1. juni på Gladsaxe Stadion. Schuelers

strategiske indsigt og internationale erfaring forventes at spille en nøglerolle,

efterhånden som holdet etablerer sig på den største europæiske scene.

"Vi er enormt glade for at kunne byde Stephen velkommen til Nordic

Storm-familien," udtaler Lars Green, medstifter af Nordic Storm. "Hans lederskab,

globale netværk og personlige dedikation til Danmark er præcis hvad vi har brug

for, når vi tager det første skridt i European League of Football. "Det at have en

profil af Stephens kaliber om bord er en game-changer for vores organisation og

vores fans."

Om Nordic Storm

Nordic Storm er Danmarks nyeste professionelle amerikanske fodboldhold, der

konkurrerer i European League of Football (ELF). Med en dedikation til sportslig

succes, samfundsengagement og internationale relationer og samarbejder sigter

Nordic Storm efter at inspirere en ny generation af amerikanske fodboldfans - både

i Danmark og uden for landets grænser.

Billetter til Nordic Storms kampe kan findes på Ticketmaster: Nordic Storm Tickets

For Sponsor- og Investeringsmuligheder venligst kontakt mp@nordicstorm.net
parts.htmlEn:
Stephen Schueler Joins Nordic Storm as Co-Owner and Board Member

Copenhagen, Denmark – April 25, 2025

Nordic Storm, Denmark’s new premier American football team, proudly announces

the appointment of Stephen Schueler as co-owner and board member. Schueler

brings a wealth of international leadership experience and a deep commitment to

fostering U.S.-Danish relations.

Currently serving as the Chief Executive Officer of Enerjen Capital, a leading

renewable clean energy company specializing in the maritime sector, Schueler has

previously held executive roles as Chief Commercial Officer at A.P. Moller-Maersk

Group, Corporate Vice President at Microsoft Corporation, and spent over two

decades at Procter & Gamble leading global retail operations.

Beyond his corporate achievements, Schueler is the President of The American

Club in Denmark, an organization dedicated to strengthening cultural and business

ties between the United States and Denmark. His connection to Denmark is further

underscored by his great-grandfather, Dr. Michael Cramer, who served as the U.S.

Ambassador to Denmark from 1870 to 1881 and to Switzerland from 1881 to 1885.

Dr. Cramer was originally from Ohio, and his diplomatic service laid the foundation

for Schueler's enduring commitment to U.S.-Danish relations. For more information

visit The American Club.

"I'm honored to join Nordic Storm and contribute to the growth of American football

in Denmark," said Schueler. "This opportunity combines my passion for sports,

leadership, and my strong personal connection to Denmark. I’m excited to help

build something truly special with the Nordic Storm."

Nordic Storm is set to play its first game on May 18th in Switzerland, with its highly

anticipated first home game in Copenhagen on June 1st at Gladsaxe Stadium.

Schueler's strategic insight and international experience are expected to play a key

role as the team establishes itself on the biggest European stage.

"We are thrilled to welcome Stephen to the Nordic Storm family," said Lars Green,

Co-Founder of Nordic Storm. "His leadership, global network, and personal

dedication to Denmark are exactly what we need as we take our first steps into the

European League of Football. Having someone of Stephen’s caliber onboard is a

game-changer for our organization and our fans."

About Nordic Storm

Nordic Storm is the newest professional American football team in Denmark,

competing in the European League of Football (ELF). With a commitment to athletic

excellence, community engagement, and international collaboration, Nordic Storm

aims to inspire a new generation of American football fans in Denmark and beyond.

Nordic Storm Game Tickets can be purchased at Ticketmaster: Nordic Storm

Tickets

For Sponsor and Investment opportunities please inquire at

mp@nordicstorm.net

partsEn.html:
The Nordic Storm has signed Danish wide receiver Simon Føns as their latest addition, pairing him with quarterback Jadrian Clark and the rest of the Storm offence for the upcoming ELF season.

"Joining the Storm means stepping into something unstoppable," Føns said. "We’re here to rewrite the order and leave it all on the field. Get ready for a season like no other."

Føns, 24, began his career with the Søllerød Gold Diggers before a standout season with the Potsdam Royals in 2023. He made history as the first European wide receiver since 2019 to surpass 1,000 receiving yards, finishing with 1,541 yards and 15 touchdowns as the Royals captured the German Football League title.

A Danish national team player since 2021, Føns brings both international experience and proven playmaking ability to the Storm.

parts.html:
Nordic Storm har hentet den danske wide receiver Simon Føns som deres nyeste tilføjelse og parrer ham med quarterback Jadrian Clark og resten af Nordic storms offence til den kommende ELF-sæson.

"At blive en del af Storm betyder at træde ind i noget ustoppeligt," sagde Føns. "Vi er her for at ændre spillet og give den alt på banen. Gør jer klar til en sæson som ingen anden."

24 årige Føns, startede sin karriere hos Søllerød Gold Diggers, inden han i 2023 havde en imponerende sæson hos Potsdam Royals. Han skrev historie som den første europæiske wide receiver siden 2019 til at nå over 1.000 receiving yards og sluttede sæsonen med 1.541 yards og 15 touchdowns, mens Royals sikrede sig mesterskabet i den tyske liga.

Som en del af det danske landshold siden 2021 bringer Føns både international erfaring og bevist spilkompetence til Nordic Storm.

parts.html: Nordic Storm fortsætter med at gøre sig bemærket i European League of Football (ELF), mens de forbereder sig på deres længe ventede debut i 2025. Den unge franchise har lavet to markante signinger: den svenske offensive lineman Viktor Neumann og den danske tight end Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen. Disse tilføjelser bringer både erfaring og nordisk talent til holdet og øger spændingen omkring ligaens første nordiske franchise.
parts.htmlEn: The Nordic Storm continues to make waves in the European League of Football (ELF) as they prepare for their highly anticipated debut in 2025. The young franchise has made two significant signings: veteran Swedish offensive lineman Viktor Neumann and Danish tight end Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen. These acquisitions add both experience and Nordic talent to the team, further heightening the excitement around the league’s first Nordic franchise.

Viktor Neumann: Size, Experience, and Homegrown Talent

Swedish offensive lineman Viktor Neumann brings an impressive combination of size and experience to the Storm. Standing 195 cm tall and weighing 145 kg, Neumann is a powerhouse on the offensive line. After stints in Germany with the Berlin Rebels in the German Football League and the Cologne Centurions in the ELF, where he helped them achieve a 6-6 record last season, Neumann is eager to make an impact on home soil.

The 22-year-old has also represented Sweden at both the U17 and senior levels and is a U19 champion with the Kristiansand Gladiators. His deep connection to Nordic football makes him a perfect fit for the Storm.

“I’m excited to represent the first ELF franchise in the Nordics, and I believe that we will be a force to be reckoned with,” said Neumann.

Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen: A Rising Star Returns to Denmark

At just 23 years old, Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen has already built an impressive résumé. The Danish tight end began his football career with the Søllerød Gold Diggers, where he played in back-to-back Danish championship games. His talents then took him to the NCAA's Baylor University in the United States, where he studied kinesiology and honed his skills at a high collegiate level.

Steinhauer’s connection to American football began during an exchange program, where he played for Joshua High School in Texas. Additionally, he has represented Denmark on the international stage, competing in the U19 European Championship in 2019.

“Such a good feeling to be back on the field healthy, sharing it with some of my best friends. No matter the outcome, the opportunity itself is a gift,” said Steinhauer, expressing his gratitude for this next chapter in his career.
parts.html:
Viktor Neumann: Størrelse, erfaring og lokal forankring

Den svenske offensive lineman Viktor Neumann kombinerer imponerende fysik og erfaring, som nu bliver en del af Storm. Med sine 195 cm og 145 kg er Neumann en kraft på den offensive linje. Efter ophold i Tyskland med Berlin Rebels i den tyske liga og Cologne Centurions i ELF, hvor han sidste sæson hjalp dem til en 6-6 sæson, er Neumann klar til at gøre en forskel på hjemmebane.

Den 22-årige har desuden repræsenteret Sverige på både U17- og seniorniveau og kan kalde sig U19-mester med Kristiansand Gladiators. Hans stærke tilknytning til nordisk football gør ham til en perfekt match for Storm.

"Jeg er spændt på at repræsentere den første ELF-franchise i Norden, og jeg tror på, at vi bliver en kraft, man skal regne med," udtaler Neumann.

Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen: Et stigende talent vender hjem til Danmark

Den kun 23-årige Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen har allerede opbygget en imponerende karriere. Den danske tight end startede sin football-rejse hos Søllerød Gold Diggers, hvor han spillede sig i to danske mesterskabsfinaler i træk. Herefter tog hans talent ham til NCAA's Baylor University i USA, hvor han studerede kinesiologi og udviklede sine færdigheder på højt college-niveau.

Steinhauers forbindelse til amerikansk football begyndte allerede i gymnasiet, da han deltog i et udvekslingsprogram og spillede for Joshua High School i Texas. Derudover har han repræsenteret Danmark på den internationale scene ved U19-EM i 2019.

"Det føles fantastisk at være tilbage på banen, sund og rask, og dele det med nogle af mine bedste venner. Uanset udfaldet er muligheden i sig selv en gave," siger Steinhauer og udtrykker sin taknemmelighed for denne nye fase i sin karriere.

partsEn.html: The Nordic Storm continues to make waves in the European League of Football (ELF) as they prepare for their highly anticipated debut in 2025. The young franchise has made two significant signings: veteran Swedish offensive lineman Viktor Neumann and Danish tight end Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen. These acquisitions add both experience and Nordic talent to the team, further heightening the excitement around the league’s first Nordic franchise.

Viktor Neumann: Size, Experience, and Homegrown Talent

Swedish offensive lineman Viktor Neumann brings an impressive combination of size and experience to the Storm. Standing 195 cm tall and weighing 145 kg, Neumann is a powerhouse on the offensive line. After stints in Germany with the Berlin Rebels in the German Football League and the Cologne Centurions in the ELF, where he helped them achieve a 6-6 record last season, Neumann is eager to make an impact on home soil.

The 22-year-old has also represented Sweden at both the U17 and senior levels and is a U19 champion with the Kristiansand Gladiators. His deep connection to Nordic football makes him a perfect fit for the Storm.

“I’m excited to represent the first ELF franchise in the Nordics, and I believe that we will be a force to be reckoned with,” said Neumann.

Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen: A Rising Star Returns to Denmark

At just 23 years old, Jonathan Steinhauer Nielsen has already built an impressive résumé. The Danish tight end began his football career with the Søllerød Gold Diggers, where he played in back-to-back Danish championship games. His talents then took him to the NCAA's Baylor University in the United States, where he studied kinesiology and honed his skills at a high collegiate level.

Steinhauer’s connection to American football began during an exchange program, where he played for Joshua High School in Texas. Additionally, he has represented Denmark on the international stage, competing in the U19 European Championship in 2019.

“Such a good feeling to be back on the field healthy, sharing it with some of my best friends. No matter the outcome, the opportunity itself is a gift,” said Steinhauer, expressing his gratitude for this next chapter in his career.

parts.html: Nordic Storm, Københavns nye hold i European League of Football (ELF), har skabt opmærksomhed ved at annoncere fem nøglesigninger til 2025-sæsonen. Disse tilføjelser inkluderer erfarne spillere og en rutineret træner, som understreger holdets dedikation til både kvalitet og konkurrenceevne.
parts.htmlEn: The Nordic Storm, Copenhagen’s new European League of Football (ELF) team, has made waves by announcing five key signings for the 2025 season. These additions include experienced players and a seasoned coach, highlighting the team’s commitment to excellence and competitive play.

Benjamin Banks Egbudiwe - Defensive Lineman

The Storm has bolstered its defensive line with Swedish standout Benjamin Banks Egbudiwe. The 6'4", 260-pound lineman brings a wealth of ELF experience, having played with the Helvetic Mercenaries and Barcelona Dragons. Over the past two seasons in the Finnish Maple League, Egbudiwe recorded 64 tackles, 18.5 tackles for loss, and 11 sacks, showcasing his dominance on the field. With his power and consistency, Egbudiwe is expected to be a game-changer for the Storm’s defense.
parts.html:
Benjamin Banks Egbudiwe – Defensive Lineman

Storm har styrket sin defensive linje med den svenske stjernespiller Benjamin Banks Egbudiwe. Den 193 cm høje og 118 kg tunge lineman kommer med en solid baggrund fra ELF, hvor han har spillet for Helvetic Mercenaries og Barcelona Dragons. I de seneste to sæsoner i den finske Maple League har Egbudiwe præsteret imponerende 64 tacklinger, 18,5 tackles for loss og 11 sacks. Med sin styrke og stabilitet forventes han at blive en nøglespiller for Storms forsvar.

Michel Andres Konate – Running Back

Den danske running back Michel Andres Konate skifter til Storm fra divisionsrivalerne Hamburg Sea Devils. Den 29-årige er stolt over at repræsentere Nordens første professionelle amerikanske fodboldhold. “Det er en fantastisk mulighed for at løfte sporten og skabe historie sammen med klubben og jer, fansene,” udtalte Konate. Kendt for sin eksplosivitet og alsidighed er han klar til at begejstre fansene og sikre sejre for København.
parts.htmlEn:
Michel Andres Konate - Running Back

Danish running back Michel Andres Konate joins the Storm from division rivals, the Hamburg Sea Devils. The 29-year-old is eager to represent the first professional football team in the Nordics. “This is an amazing opportunity to elevate the sport and make history alongside the club and you, the fans,” Konate stated. Known for his explosiveness and versatility, Konate aims to electrify fans and bring home victories for Copenhagen.

parts.imageTextEn: Kristoffer Brun Hansen and Mads Marquard
parts.imageText: Kristoffer Brun Hansen og Mads Marquard

parts.htmlEn:
Kristoffer Brun Hansen and Mads Marquard - Defensive Line

The Storm adds a dynamic duo to its defensive line with the signing of Kristoffer Brun Hansen and Mads Marquard. Both players come out of retirement to join the Storm, reigniting a partnership that made them a formidable force with the Copenhagen Towers. Their synergy and experience promise to create havoc for opposing offenses, making the Storm’s defense a force to be reckoned with.
parts.html:
Kristoffer Brun Hansen og Mads Marquard – Defensive Line

Storm har sikret sig et dynamisk makkerpar til deres defensive linje med signingerne af Kristoffer Brun Hansen og Mads Marquard. Begge spillere kommer ud af pension for at spille for Storm og genoptager et samarbejde, der tidligere gjorde dem frygtede hos Copenhagen Towers. Deres samspil og erfaring vil skabe kaos for modstandernes offensiver og gøre Storms forsvar til en magtfaktor i ligaen.

Luis de las Heras Villarreal – Tight End Coach

Den mexicanske træner Luis de las Heras Villarreal er blevet udnævnt til Storms nye tight end-træner. Med en karriere, der spænder over Mexico, Spanien og Skandinavien, bringer de las Heras Villarreal en omfattende erfaring som både spiller og træner. Efter succesfulde ophold i Finland og Danmark udtrykte han sin begejstring for at blive en del af Storm: “Vi ved, hvor konkurrencedygtig fodbold er i Skandinavien, og nu er det tid til at bringe Stormen til resten af ligaen.” Hans ekspertise vil være afgørende for at opbygge en topklasse tight end-enhed.
parts.htmlEn:
Luis de las Heras Villarreal - Tight End Coach

Mexican coach Luis de las Heras Villarreal has been appointed as the Storm’s new tight end coach. With a career spanning Mexico, Spain, and Scandinavia, de las Heras Villarreal brings extensive experience as both a player and coach. After successful stints in Finland and Denmark, he expressed his excitement about joining the Storm: “We know how competitive football is in Scandinavia, now it’s time to bring the storm to the rest of the league.” His expertise will be pivotal in shaping a top-tier tight end unit.

parts.imageTextEn: Nordic Storm adds multiple homegrown talents ahead of the 2025 season
parts.imageText: Nordic Storm henter flere lokale talenter frem imod 2025 sæsonen

parts.htmlEn:
As the Nordic Storm prepares for its highly anticipated debut in the European League of Football (ELF) in 2025, the team is making significant moves to solidify its roster. With a strong commitment to showcasing Nordic football talent, the organization has added several Danish and Swedish players across multiple positions, as well as international gamechangers at the coaching positions. Below is a breakdown of the latest additions by position.

Offensive Linemen

Troels Hammer (Denmark, OT)

A true veteran of the Danish football scene, Troels Hammer brings a decade of experience with the Søllerød Gold Diggers and the Danish national team. Standing at 203 cm, the former national team captain is known for his strength and leadership. Despite his size, Hammer possesses impressive speed, making him a formidable opponent for defenders. He is eager to prove that Nordic football can thrive at the highest level in the ELF.

David Strobel (Sweden, OT)

A versatile lineman with experience on both sides of the ball, David Strobel joins the Storm after an award-winning season in Sweden's Superserien, where he was named the "2024 Lineman of the Year." The 188 cm, 135 kg Swedish national team player has played for several European teams, including the Limhamn Griffins (Sweden), Badalona Dracs (Spain), and Søllerød Gold Diggers (Denmark). His addition further strengthens the Storm's trenches.

Defensive Backs

Phillip Holm (Denmark, DB)

After competing in the ELF with the Madrid Bravos last season and prior experience in Switzerland, Phillip Holm is returning home to Denmark. Having played multiple years with the Søllerød Gold Diggers, he is widely regarded as one of Denmark's top defenders. Known for his athleticism and elite defensive instincts, Holm is excited to showcase his skills in front of his home crowd.

Elliot Krogius (Sweden, DB)

A standout in Sweden's Superserien league, Elliot Krogius comes to the ELF from AIK. A Swedish national team player, Krogius also has experience coaching the Swedish U19 team while maintaining his role as a defensive back. His leadership and versatility will be crucial assets for the Storm's secondary.

Quarterback

Alexander Kronborg (Denmark, QB)

A household name in Danish football, Alexander Kronborg is the national team quarterback for both the tackle and flag football squads. Coming off a championship-winning season with the Copenhagen Towers in the Danish National League, Kronborg has also played internationally in the German Football League (GFL) with the Ravensburg Razorbacks. His experience, playmaking ability, and football IQ make him a vital piece of the Storm's offense.

Linebackers

David Tawake (Denmark, LB)

A young but battle-tested Danish national team player, David Tawake joins the Storm from the Søllerød Gold Diggers. He has played multiple positions throughout his career and served as a team captain. With a reputation for toughness and leadership, Tawake is expected to bring intensity and depth to the Storm's defense.

Hugo Dyrendahl (Sweden, LB)

A proven performer at the ELF level, Hugo Dyrendahl has previously played for Frankfurt Galaxy and the Barcelona Dragons. He was recognized as a second-team All-Pro linebacker in the 2024 ELF season, solidifying his place among the league's elite defenders. His experience and skill set will be invaluable for the Storm's defensive unit.

Wide Receivers

Edvin Almeida (Sweden, WR)

Coming from the Tyresö Royal Crowns in Sweden, Edvin Almeida has also represented the Swedish national team. At 25 years old, he is eager to integrate into the Storm's strong receiving corps and contribute to the team's success in its debut season.

Coaching Staff

Michael Williams (Wide Receivers Coach)

An American coach who has been residing in Denmark for years, Michael Williams has played a crucial role in developing Danish receivers at the national team level. Now taking his expertise to the ELF, Williams is enthusiastic about helping Nordic talent shine on a bigger stage.

Philipp Fronik (Inside Linebackers Coach)

An experienced Austrian coach, Philipp Fronik has worked with the Copenhagen Towers and the Danish U19 national team. His knowledge and coaching acumen will be instrumental in developing the Storm’s linebackers.
parts.html:
Mens Nordic Storm forbereder sig til sin længe ventede debut i European League of Football (ELF) i 2025, foretager holdet betydelige tiltag for at styrke sin trup. Med en klar ambition om at fremhæve nordisk fodboldtalent har organisationen tilføjet flere danske og svenske spillere på tværs af positioner samt internationale profiler på trænerstaben. Her er en oversigt over de seneste tilgange opdelt efter position.

Offensive Linemen

Troels Hammer (Danmark, OT)

En sand veteran inden for dansk amerikansk fodbold, Troels Hammer bringer et årti af erfaring fra Søllerød Gold Diggers og det danske landshold. Med sine 203 cm er den tidligere landsholdskaptajn kendt for sin styrke og lederskab. Til trods for sin imponerende statur besidder Hammer overraskende hurtighed, hvilket gør ham til en udfordring for forsvarsspillere. Han ser frem til at bevise, at nordisk fodbold kan konkurrere på højeste niveau i ELF.

David Strobel (Sverige, OT)

En alsidig linjemand med erfaring på begge sider af bolden, David Strobel slutter sig til Storm efter en præmiesæson i Sveriges Superserien, hvor han blev kåret til "2024 Lineman of the Year." Den 188 cm, 135 kg tunge svenske landsholdsspiller har spillet for flere europæiske hold, herunder Limhamn Griffins (Sverige), Badalona Dracs (Spanien) og Søllerød Gold Diggers (Danmark). Hans tilgang styrker Storms offensive linje yderligere.

Defensive Backs

Phillip Holm (Danmark, DB)

Efter at have spillet i ELF med Madrid Bravos sidste sæson og tidligere erfaring i Schweiz, vender Phillip Holm hjem til Danmark. Han har i flere år spillet for Søllerød Gold Diggers og er bredt anerkendt som en af Danmarks bedste forsvarsspillere. Holm er kendt for sin atletiske evne og defensive instinkter på højt niveau og ser frem til at vise sit talent på hjemmebane.

Elliot Krogius (Sverige, DB)

En profil fra Sveriges Superserien-liga, Elliot Krogius kommer til ELF fra AIK. Udover at spille for det svenske landshold har Krogius også erfaring som træner for det svenske U19-landshold. Hans lederskab og alsidighed vil være værdifulde aktiver for Storms secondary.

Quarterback

Alexander Kronborg (Danmark, QB)

Et kendt navn i dansk amerikansk fodbold, Alexander Kronborg er landsholdets quarterback for både tackle og flag football. Han kommer fra en mesterskabssæson med Copenhagen Towers i den danske National Liga og har også spillet internationalt i German Football League (GFL) med Ravensburg Razorbacks. Hans erfaring, evne til at skabe spil og fodboldforståelse gør ham til en nøglespiller i Storms offensiv.

Linebackers

David Tawake (Danmark, LB)

En ung, men erfaren dansk landsholdsspiller, David Tawake slutter sig til Storm fra Søllerød Gold Diggers. Han har spillet flere positioner gennem sin karriere og har fungeret som holdkaptajn. Med et ry for hårdt spil og lederskab forventes Tawake at tilføre intensitet og dybde til Storms forsvar.

Hugo Dyrendahl (Sverige, LB)

En bevist spiller på ELF-niveau, Hugo Dyrendahl har tidligere spillet for Frankfurt Galaxy og Barcelona Dragons. Han blev udvalgt til ELF All-Pro Second Team i 2024-sæsonen, hvilket cementerer hans status som en af ligaens bedste linebackere. Hans erfaring og evner vil være uvurderlige for Storms defensive enhed.

Wide Receivers

Edvin Almeida (Sverige, WR)

Edvin Almeida kommer fra Tyresö Royal Crowns i Sverige og har også repræsenteret det svenske landshold. Den 25-årige receiver er ivrig efter at blive en del af Storms stærke receivergruppe og bidrage til holdets succes i deres debutår.

Trænerstab

Michael Williams (Wide Receivers Coach)

En amerikansk træner, der har boet i Danmark i mange år, Michael Williams har spillet en central rolle i udviklingen af danske receivere på landsholdsniveau. Nu bringer han sin ekspertise til ELF og ser frem til at hjælpe nordisk talent med at shine på den store scene.

Philipp Fronik (Inside Linebackers Coach)

En erfaren østrigsk træner, Philipp Fronik har arbejdet med Copenhagen Towers og det danske U19-landshold. Hans viden og trænerfærdigheder vil spille en afgørende rolle i udviklingen af Storms linebackere.

MKGlIknMHrqsPDR1IRMT.title: ELF-mestre skifter til Nordic Storm: Sikrer sig to af ligaens største stjerner
MKGlIknMHrqsPDR1IRMT.titleEn: ELF champions move to Nordic Storm: Securing two of the leagues top stars

parts.html:
Nordic Storm henter de to største stjerner hos de regerende ELF-mestre fra tyske Rhein Fire. Quarterback Jadrian Clark og runningback Glen Toonga har netop skrevet under på en 1-årig aftale med det nye nordiske hold.

Nordic Storm har netop sikret sig ligaens to bedste spillere fra de regerende mestre, Rhein Fire.

Quarterback Jadrian Clark og runningback Glen Toonga har begge underskrevet 1-årige kontrakter og bliver de første spillere på det nye hold i Norden.

„På alle gode hold er de bedste spillere også dem, der arbejder hårdest. Sådan er det med Jadrian Clark og Glen Toonga. Det har været et privilegium at arbejde sammen med disse to tidligere, og hos Nordic Storm er vi begejstrede for at få deres lederskab, energi og præstationer med i sæsonen 2025,”

siger Head Coach John Shoop fra Nordic Storm.

Europas bedste offensive duo

30-årige Jadrian Clark og 29-årige Glen Toonga har de seneste to sæsoner domineret European League of Football (ELF) som nøglespillere hos Rhein Fire.

Jadrian Clark blev i 2023 kåret til ligaens vigtigste spiller (MVP) og de senest to år i streg blevet kåret finalekampenes MVP. Glen Toonga blev i år kåret til ligaens MVP efter at have sat imponerende rekorder med over 1500 rushing yards og 30 touchdowns i den seneste sæson.

Nu forlader de to stjernespillere Rhein Fire for i stedet at tage Norden med storm som de første spillere for det nordiske mandskab.

„Jadrian Clark er utrolig intelligent og i stand til at håndtere komplekse gameplans både under træningen i løbet af ugen og ved scrimmage-linjen på kampdag. Vigtigst af alt er Jadrian en fantastisk holdkammerat, der holder både sig selv og andre ansvarlige. Jeg er blevet en bedre træner af at arbejde sammen med ham og ser frem til at arbejde sammen igen i 2025,”

siger Head Coach John Shoop, der også sætter ord på signingen af Glen Toonga:

„Glen Toongas præstationer er et direkte resultat af hans arbejdsmoral både på og uden for banen. Glens træningsvaner er et forbillede for alle hans holdkammerater. Jeg har haft fornøjelsen af at kende Glen siden 2022, og hans iver efter at forbedre sig hvert år er inspirerende. Jeg ser frem til at arbejde sammen med Glen for at hjælpe ham med at blive den mest komplette spiller, han kan være,” slutter John Shoop.

Nordic Storm vil løbende præsentere flere spillere.

partsEn.html:
Nordic Storm has picked up the two top stars of the reigning ELF champions from German Rhein Fire. Quarterback Jadrian Clark and running back Glen Toonga have just signed a one-year deal with the new Nordic team.

American football in the Nordic region will take a quantum leap forward when Nordic Storm enters the European League of Football (ELF) next year.

The new team has just secured two of the league's top players from the reigning champions, Rhein Fire.

Quarterback Jadrian Clark and running back Glen Toonga have both signed a one-year contract and will be the first players on the new team in the Nordic region.

“On all good teams, the best players are the hardest workers. Such is the case with Jadrian Clark and Glen Toonga. It has been my privilege to work alongside these men in the past and the Nordic Storm is excited to have their leadership, spirit, and production for the 2025 season,”

says Head Coach John Shoop from Nordic Storm.

Europe's best offensive duo

30-year-old Jadrian Clark and 29-year-old Glen Toonga have dominated the ELF for the past two seasons as key players for Rhein Fire.

Jadrian Clark was named the league's Most Valuable Player (MVP) in 2023 and has been awarded the MVP of the final games for the past two consecutive years. Glen Toonga was named the league's MVP this year after setting impressive records with over 1,500 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in the latest season.

Now, the two star players are leaving Rhein Fire to make a mark in the Nordic region as the first players for the Nordic team.

“Jadrian Clark is extremely bright and capable of handling complex gameplans during the practice week and at the line of scrimmage on game day. He models excellent preparation on and off the field. The evidence is clear in his uncommon production throughout his career. Importantly, Jadrian is a great teammate who holds himself and others accountable. I am a better coach because of the time I've spent with him and look forward to working together again in 2025,”

explains Head Coach John Shoop.

“Glen Toonga's production is a direct by-product of his work ethic on and off the field. Glen's practice and workout habits are a model for all of his teammates. I have had the privilege of knowing Glen since 2022 and his hunger to improve every year is inspiring. I look forward to working alongside Glen to help him become the most complete player he's capable of being as we lead the Nordic Storm into their inaugural season.”

Nordic Storm will continuously present more players.

NQ3zKpQ9a2LRcpCOjCvn.title: Nordic Storm byder Adrià Botella Moreno velkommen til København
NQ3zKpQ9a2LRcpCOjCvn.titleEn: Nordic Storm Welcomes Adrià Botella Moreno to Copenhagen

parts.htmlEn:
Year five, team number five – Adrià Botella Moreno’s journey in the European League of Football now brings him to Nordic Storm. We are proud to welcome one of the most accomplished tight ends in the league as we continue building a championship-caliber roster for our debut season.

Since the ELF’s first season, Adrià has proven himself as one of the league’s elite players, earning a spot on the All-Star team every single year. His experience, leadership, and consistency make him a game-changer on any team, and we are excited to see him make an impact in Copenhagen.

Standing at 1.98 meters, Adrià is a dominant force both as a blocker and a receiver. He ranks among the top ten all-time in several ELF receiving categories, with 174 catches, 2,080 receiving yards, and 23 touchdowns in 45 games. His ability to control the field makes him a perfect addition to our offense.

With this signing, we continue to strengthen our team and set our sights on competing at the highest level. Adrià brings a winning mentality and proven talent to Nordic Storm, and we can’t wait to see him in action as we take on the ELF in 2025.

Welcome to Copenhagen, Adrià!
parts.html:
Femte sæson, femte hold – Adrià Botella Morenos rejse i European League of Football fører ham nu til Nordic Storm. Vi er stolte af at kunne præsentere en af ligaens mest erfarne og talentfulde tight ends som en del af vores mandskab, når vi bygger et hold, der kan konkurrere om mesterskabet i vores debutsæson.

Siden ELF’s første sæson har Adrià bevist, at han hører til blandt de absolut bedste spillere i ligaen, og han har sikret sig en plads på All-Star-holdet hvert eneste år. Hans erfaring, lederskab og stabilitet gør ham til en gamechanger, og vi ser frem til at se ham gøre en forskel i København.

Med en højde på 1,98 meter er Adrià en dominerende spiller både som blocker og receiver. Han ligger blandt de ti bedste i ELF’s historie inden for flere receiver-kategorier med 174 catches, 2.080 receiving yards og 23 touchdowns i 45 kampe. Hans evne til at kontrollere spillet gør ham til en perfekt tilføjelse til vores offensiv.

Med denne signing fortsætter vi med at styrke vores hold og går efter at konkurrere på højeste niveau. Adrià bringer en vindersmentalitet og dokumenteret talent til Nordic Storm, og vi kan ikke vente med at se ham i aktion, når vi træder ind i ELF i 2025.

Velkommen til København, Adrià!

parts.imageTextEn: Nordic Storm beat Helvetic Mercenaries in season opener
parts.imageText: Nordic Storm slog Helvetic Mercenaries i sæsonåbneren

parts.html:
Søndag eftermiddag spillede det nystartede mandskab på udebane mod Helvetic Mercenaries fra Schweiz, og det nordiske hold trak sig meget overbevisende ud af kampen med en storsejr.

Kampen startede låst med to forsvar der spillede godt, og et misset field goal fra Nordic Storm gjorde, at der ved udgangen af første quarter stadig ikke var blevet scoret endnu. Det ændrede sig dog i andet quarter, hvor der for alvor blev åbnet for sluserne. Først ved 2024 MVP (Most Valuable Player) Glen Toonga på et 14-yard Touchdown, og senere fandt Jadrian Clark på et kort kast Mikkel Hansen til stillingen 12-0. Herefter reducerede Mercenaries til 12-6, hvorefter Storm scorede yderligere to touchdowns af Wide Receiver Brendan Beaulieu og Tight Adrià Botella Moreno til pausestillingen 25-6. 

Anden halvleg bød også på mange point, og her var det schweizerne, der kom bedst fra start, da deres forsvar samlede en løs bold op og reducerede til 25-12. Men derefter stod der Nordic Storm på det hele, og det dansk-svenske mandskab scorede nærmest som det passede dem. Først Alexander Kennedy på et 22-yard Touchdown, hvorefter Botella Moreno kom på tavlen for anden gang på et kort kast til stillingen 37-12. 

Forsvaret fra Nordic Storm, der stor spillede igennem hele kampen, med flere Sacks, Turnovers og store spil, stod også for en scoring da Safety Luke Glenna interceptede modstanderens Quarterback og løb hele vejen til et 63-yard Touchdown, og så var der ikke længere tvivl om kampens ensidige udfald. Til sidst scorede Brendan Beaulieu sit andet Touchdown i kampen og til sidst lukkede Anton Witmeur scorings festen med et langt løb til den endelige stilling på 56-12. 

Nordic Storm leverede en imponerende debut, hvor både angrebet og forsvaret spillede på et højt niveau. Quarterback Jadrian Clark kastede hele 5 Touchdowns i sin første kamp for Nordic Storm, og yderligere blev der løbet for næsten 300 yards anført af ligaens forsvarende MVP, Glen Toonga. Men den måske mest imponerende præstation var holdets forsvar. De skabte konstant pres på modstanderens quarterback, tog bolden fra modstanderen ved flere lejligheder og spillede som enhed med en fysik og intensitet, som modstanderen tydeligt ikke kunne matche. 

På trods af holdets meget overbevisende sejr var der stadig muligheder for forbedringer. Nordic Storm vil formentlig have fokus på at komme bedre fra start i næste kamp, og også forbedre deres kicking, hvor flere ekstra point og field goals blev brændt, som kan vise sig at være kostbare i tætte kampe. 

Holdet spiller på søndag d. 25 maj sæsonens anden kamp på udebane mod Wroclaw Panthers, og har weekenden efter første kamp nogensinde d. 1 juni på Gladsaxe Stadion mod Berlin Thunder.
parts.htmlEn:
On Sunday afternoon, the newly formed team played their first away game against the Helvetic Mercenaries from Switzerland, and the Nordic squad delivered an emphatic win.

The game began as a defensive battle, with both teams playing solid defense, and a missed field goal by Nordic Storm meant the first quarter ended scoreless. That changed in the second quarter, when the floodgates opened. First, 2024 MVP Glen Toonga scored on a 14-yard touchdown run, followed by quarterback Jadrian Clark finding Mikkel Hansen with a short pass to make it 12-0. The Mercenaries responded by narrowing the score to 12-6, but Storm surged ahead with two more touchdowns—one by wide receiver Brendan Beaulieu and another by tight end Adrià Botella Moreno—bringing the halftime score to 25-6.

The second half also featured plenty of scoring. The Swiss side started strong, recovering a fumble and scoring to reduce the lead to 25-12. But from there, it was all Nordic Storm, who scored almost at will. Alexander Kennedy added a 22-yard touchdown, followed by Botella Moreno’s second touchdown of the day from a short pass to make it 37-12.

The Nordic Storm defense, which played exceptionally all game with multiple sacks, turnovers, and big plays, also got on the scoreboard. Safety Luke Glenna intercepted the opposing quarterback and returned it 63 yards for a touchdown, leaving no doubt about the outcome. Brendan Beaulieu later scored his second touchdown, and finally, Anton Witmeur capped off the scoring frenzy with a long run, making the final score 56-12.

Nordic Storm delivered an impressive debut performance, with both offense and defense playing at a high level. Quarterback Jadrian Clark threw five touchdowns in his first game for the team, and nearly 300 rushing yards were gained, led by reigning league MVP Glen Toonga. However, perhaps the most remarkable aspect was the team’s defense, which constantly pressured the opposing quarterback, forced multiple turnovers, and played with a physicality and intensity the opponent couldn’t match.

Despite the convincing victory, there are still areas for improvement. Nordic Storm will likely focus on starting stronger in their next game and improving their kicking game, as several extra points and field goals were missed—mistakes that could prove costly in tighter matches.

The team plays their second match of the season on Sunday, May 25, away against the Wrocław Panthers, followed by their first-ever home game on June 1 at Gladsaxe Stadium against Berlin Thunder.

QVqB9lpxkLENkIEgRsFw.title: Nordic Storm drager til Schweiz for at spille klubbens første kamp nogensinde
QVqB9lpxkLENkIEgRsFw.titleEn: Nordic Storm heads to Switzerland for the first game in Franchise History

parts.html:
Søndag d. 18 maj skrives der et nyt kapitel i dansk sportshistorie. Det storsatsende Gladsaxe-baserede mandskab Nordic Storm spiller sin første kamp nogensinde i den bedste europæiske række inden for amerikansk fodbold, European League of Football (ELF). 

Nordic Storm blev tilbage i september måned præsenteret som den nyeste franchise i ligaen og siden da er tingene ikke gået stille for sig. Først præsenterede man den tidligere NFL-træner John Shoop, og ikke længe efter også ligaens MVPs (Mest værdifulde spiller) for henholdsvis 2023- og 2024-sæsonen, Quarterback Jadrian Clark og Running Back Glen Toonga. 

Og dette er blot nogle af de prominente spiller- og trænernavne som har tilsluttet sig det dansk-svenske hold. Flere spillere ,der har gjort sig bemærket på den største scene i Europa, er også kommet til. Ikke mindre end ni spillere på mandskabet har tidligere været at finde på ligaens All Star hold gennem de sidste fire forgangne sæsoner. 

Quarterback Jadrian Clark lavede sammen med sin Running Back Glen Toonga fra Rhein Fire et meget vovet og atypisk skifte inden sæsonen. Han havde vundet de to seneste mesterskaber, flere MVP-titler og var efterhånden blevet et ikon hos ELF´s stærkeste mandskab - både sportsligt og kommercielt. Men i stedet for at fortsætte i de trygge rammer, flyttede han til København og skrev under med ligaens nyeste og uprøvede tilkommer, Nordic Storm. Her giver han svar på nogle af de spørgsmål, der unægteligt følger i ugen op til holdets første kamp nogensinde: 

Du har været en del af tre ud af de sidste fire ELF-finalehold. Hvordan tror du, at dette Nordic Storm-hold kan klare sig i forhold til resten af konkurrencen givet dine tidligere erfaringer med succesfulde hold? 

“Jeg har været så heldig at være en del af nogle fantastiske organisationer og mesterskabshold i ELF, og jeg ser mange lignende kvaliteter hos dette Nordic Storm hold. Talentet her er ubestrideligt, fra den lokale kerne til importspillere er der et højt niveau af atletisk formåen, intelligens og sult efter at konkurrere. Det, der adskiller succesrige hold fra mindre succesrige, er dog ikke kun talent; det er kulturen og de daglige vaner. Det bygger vi her. Det er tidligt, men hvis vi fortsætter med at trende i den rigtige retning, er der ingen grund til, at dette hold ikke kan være med blandt de bedste.” 

Talentet på Storm-listen er stort. Men hvor svært er det at bygge kemi og samle et hold på kun to måneder? 

“Det er bestemt en udfordring. Du forsøger at fastholde relationer og forståelse, som normalt tager en hel sæson at opbygge. Men den gode nyhed er, at alle kom ind med det rigtige mindset. Vi er ydmyge, sultne og villige til at lægge det arbejde der skal til. Vores trænerstab og folkene omkring holdet har også gjort et godt stykke arbejde med at skabe en struktur, der accelererer den kemi, vi prøver at skabe både på og uden for banen. Det er ikke perfekt endnu, men vi bevæger os hurtigt i den rigtige retning. Nøglen er at blive ved med at kommunikere, blive ved med at lære og stole på processen.“ 

Helvetic Mercenaries er et hold, der har gennemgået mange ændringer siden sidste sæson. Hvordan ser du deres chancer i år, og hvordan tror du I klarer jer i den første kamp i Nordic Storms historie? 

Mercenaries har haft en masse udskiftninger, som kan være et tohovedet sværd - nogle gange tilfører det ny energi og skaber en frisk start. De har tilføjet nogle store talenter og har playmakere på begge sider af bolden, så vi tager slet ikke let på dem. Når det er sagt, så har vi fokus på os. Det er et stort øjeblik, den første kamp i Storms historie. Vi begynder vores rejse, hvor vi gerne vil sætte tonen for, hvem vi er som et hold. Det handler om eksekvering, disciplin og at spille for hinanden. Hvis vi gør det, så kan jeg rigtigt godt lide vores chancer.
parts.htmlEn:
Sunday May 18th, a new chapter in Danish sports history will be written. The high-powered Gladsaxe-based team, Nordic Storm, is playing its first ever match in the European League of Football (ELF). 

Nordic Storm was presented back in September as the newest franchise in the league and since then a lot has happened. First, former NFL coach John Shoop was introduced, and not long after also the league's MVPs (Most Valuable Player) for the 2023 and 2024 seasons, respectively, Quarterback Jadrian Clark and Running Back Glen Toonga. 

And these are just some of the prominent players and coaching names who have joined the Danish-Swedish based team. Several players who have made a name for themselves on the biggest stage in Europe have also joined. No less than nine players on the team have previously been on the league's All Star team over the past four seasons.

Quarterback Jadrian Clark made a bold move together with his Running Back Glen Toonga from Rhein Fire. A very daring and atypical transfer. He had won the two most recent championships, several MVP titles and had gradually become an icon with ELF's strongest team - both on the field and commercially. But instead of continuing in the safe environment, he moved to Copenhagen and signed with the league's newest and unproven addition, Nordic Storm. Here he gives his answers to some of the questions that undeniably follow in the week leading up to the team's first ever game: 

You have Been a part of 3 out the last four ELF finals teams. How do you Think this Nordic Storm team stacks up against the rest of the competition given your past experience with successful teams? 

I’ve been fortunate to be part of some great organizations and championship level teams in the ELF, and I see a lot of similar qualities in this Nordic Storm group. The talent here is undeniable, from the local core to the imports, there’s a high level of athleticism, football IQ, and hunger to compete. What sets successful teams apart isn’t just talent though; it’s the culture, the buy-in, and the daily habits. We’re building that here. It’s early, but if we keep trending in the right direction, there’s no reason this team can’t be right there with the best. 

The talent on the Storm roster is undeniable. But how difficult is it to build chemistry and bring a team together in only two months? (Less than two months for imports) 

It’s definitely a challenge. You’re trying to fast-track relationships and understanding that usually take a whole off-season to build. But the good news is everyone came in with the right mindset. We’re humble, hungry, and willing to put the work in. The staff has also done a great job creating a structure that accelerates that chemistry on and off the field. It’s not perfect yet, but we’re moving fast in the right direction. The key is to keep communicating, keep learning, and trust the process.

The Helvetic Mercenaries are a team that has gone through a lot of changes since last season. How do you see their chances this year and How do you stack up against them in the first game in Nordic Storm history? 

The Mercenaries have had a lot of turnover, but that can be a double-edged sword — sometimes it injects new energy and creates a fresh start. They’ve added some real talent and have playmakers on both sides of the ball, so we’re not taking them lightly at all. That said, we’re focused on us. It’s a big moment, the first game in Storm history. We’re approaching it like we want to set the tone for who we are as a team. It’s about execution, discipline, and playing for each other. If we do that, I like our chances.

parts.html:
Flere Nordic Storm spillere at holde øje med: 

Running Back, Glen Toonga 

En atletisk formåen, evne til at læse spillet og power som ikke er set før fra en europæisk Running Back illustrerer glimrende den alsidighed Toonga besidder, og hvorfor han kan være omdrejningspunktet for ethvert angreb i ligaen. Han har ligeledes udviklet sig i kastespillet, og kan han fortsætte dette, er det svært at se hvordan ligaens forsvar skal stoppe ham. 1576 yards og 30 Touchdowns i 2024 taler sit helt klare sprog, hvilket også blev blev belønnet med titlen som ligaens mest værdifulde spiller i 2024. 

Center, Joachim Christensen 

Den store linjemand er uden sammenligning den dansker, som har haft størst succes inden for amerikansk fodbold i Europa. Inden for ligaens første tre sæsoner stod Joachim Christensen allerede noteret for to mesterskaber - og endda hos to forskellige mandskaber. Først hos Frankfurt Galaxy i ligaens debutsæson og senere sammen med Clark og Toonga i Rhein Fire i 2023. Herefter stoppede Christensen karrieren, men muligheden hos Nordic Storm fik danskeren til at vende tilbage som aktiv spiller. 

Teknisk snilde kombineret med aggression er kendetegnet ved danskerens spillestil, og med sine 31 år bringer han ligeledes en vigtig rutine og erfaring til det nye mandskab, som andre mere uprøvede holdkammerater kan trække på. 

Linebacker, Ludvig Myren 

Svenskeren, som over de seneste tre sæsoner har etableret sig som en stor profil i ligaen hos Berlin Thunder, har ligeledes skiftet til det nye nordiske hold. Myren besidder en fart og nogle instinkter, der gør at han altid er omkring boldholderen. Han har ligeledes en evne til at skabe turnovers og står endda noteret for hele fire defensive Touchdowns i sin tid i ligaen. Han bringer ligeledes en utroligt passioneret mentalitet, når han skaber kaos for modstanderens angreb i midten af sit forsvar. Den blot 24-årige svensker blev tilmed kåret som sidste sæsons 7. bedste spiller, hvilket er den klart højeste rangering for en nordisk spiller i ligaens historie. 

Cornerback, Exavier Edwards 

Ligesom Clark og Toonga har Edwards over de seneste inventar været en profil og fast inventar hos et af ligaens stærkeste mandskaber, Vienna Vikings. Han valgte ligeledes at skifte til det nye nordiske hold, og her er der tale om en unik spiller, som er utroligt alsidig. Ikke nok med at han kan spille samtlige positioner i forsvarets bagerste kæde, så er hans hurtighed, acceleration og retningsskift blandt det bedste der nogensinde er set i Europa, hvorfor han også tidligere er blevet brugt på angrebet. Den tidligere All-Star har også en evne til at tage bolden fra modstanderne. Hele 10 turnovers har den 33-årige amerikaner skabt i sine i alt 24 kampe. Og så er han en af de bedste returners i ligaen. 

Nu er det endelig blevet tid at finde ud af, om de mange imponerende og opsigtsvækkende tilgange og transfers, som Nordic Storm har lavet, bærer frugt fra start af. Søndag d. 18 maj står det Schweiziske mandskab Helvetic Mercenaries klar til at tage imod det helt nye hold i ligaen.. Et Schweizisk hold som efter sidste års skuffende sæson med kun en enkelt sejr har gennemgået en lang række udskiftninger - både på træner- og spillersiden. Der er både kommet ny cheftræner til, Marcus Herford, som stod for en række flotte resultater i Europas næstbedste række, German Football League, hos nyoprykkede Hildesheim Invaders, som han tog til slutspillet. Med sig har han bragt en af sidste sæsons mest underholdende og spektakulære spillere i Quarterback Isaiah Weed. Selvom præstationerne hos Cologne Centurions var svingende, så var det tydeligt at når han ramte topniveauet, så var han utroligt svær at stoppe, selv for de bedste forsvar i ligaen. 

Skiftet på de to mest centrale poster på et amerikansk fodboldhold viser tydeligt at Helvetic Mercenaries har lavet nogle drastiske ændringer for at kunne blive mere konkurrencedygtige end sidste års position som bundhold, hvor man også i flere kampe måtte se sig markant overmatchet af modstanderen. Det er dog tydeligt, at der er en masse uforløst potentiale hos mandskabet, og mangel på top talent er tydeligvis ikke et problem, når truppen nærstuderes. Det altoverskyggende spørgsmål er blot om bredden i truppen er tilstrækkelig. 

Helvetic Mercenaries spillere at holde øje med: 

Quarterback Isaiah Weed: 

Den hurtige amerikaner stod i sidste sæson for store underholdningsmomenter. Den meget improviserende spillestil kombineret med en god atletisk formåen gjorde at Weed voldte flere af ligaens forsvar store problemer. Selvom hans 2553 kastede yards og 17 kastede touchdowns ikke er skyhøje tal, så er det stadig imponerende, såfremt de kombineres med hans produktion i løbespillet. Her løb den 27-årige Quarterback for over 700 yards og tilføjede yderligere 8 Touchdowns. 

Wide Receiver Keelan Cole 

Rent statistisk er dette den klart mest prominente og succesfulde spiller, der nogensinde har været i ligaen. Keelan Cole var i flere år starter i NFL, hvor han formåede at gribe for næten 3000 yards i de i alt seks sæsoner han spillede i verdens bedste liga. Spiller han på dette niveau i ELF, så er det på ingen måde utænkeligt at Cole bliver en af de helt store profiler i ligaen i år, og en spiller der kan tage Mercenaries til nye højder. Dog er han blevet 32 år og det er efterhånden nogle år siden at spillede i NFL (2022). Er han stadig den samme eksplosive playmaker? 

Wide Receiver Milan Spiller: 

Eksplosivitet og fart kendetegner Schweizeren, der i den forgangne sæson blev kåret som den bedste offensive førsteårs spiller, og var et stort lyspunkt i en ellers svær sæson. Han brød den eftertragtede barriere på 1000 yards for en europæisk receiver, da han lige akkurat endte på 1008 og dertilhørende 5 Touchdowns. Den blot 21-årige stjerne skal sammen med Cole danne en af ligaens mest potente duoer, og det bliver spændende at se om den lynhurtige receiver kan løfte sit niveau yderligere. 

Defensive End De'Marco Artis: 

En ny spiller i ELF-regi, men amerikaneren har allerede vist prøver på sit niveau i Europa. I 2023 slog Artis rekorden for flest sacks i den finske liga, da han nedlagde modstanderens Quarterback hele 12 gange. Inden da var han en profil hos West Florida University, hvor han forinden spillede et år for det anderkendte Baylor University. Sammen med den meget unge og talentfulde RJ Sagna på modsatte side, skal han forsøge at skabe pres på modstanderens Quarterback. 

Cornerback Marko Ilic: 

Lidt atypisk finder vi i denne kamp en spiller på modstanderens mandskab med danske rødder. Den dansk-serbiske cornerback valgte i stedet for at prøve kræfter på Storm holdet at tage til Helvetic Mercenaries, hvor han skal bruge sin gode fysik og størrelse til at lukke ned for modstanderens bedste receiver. Med et stort vingefang og styrke er Ilic en spiller, der kan være svær at komme forbi som receiver, og rammer han dagen, er det ikke utænkeligt at han kan forstyrre timingen mellem modstanderens Quarterback og receivers. 

Kampen fløjtes i gang på søndag kl. 13 og kan ses på DAZN Streaming. 

Nordic Storm spiller første hjemmekamp d. 1 juni på Gladsaxe Stadion, hvor der er lagt op til en football oplevelse udover det sædvanlige. 

Billetter kan findes på Ticketmaster: Nordic Storm Billetter
parts.htmlEn:
More Nordic Storm players to watch: 

Running Back, Glen Toonga 

Top notch athleticism, vision and power not seen before from a European Running Back perfectly illustrates the versatility Toonga possesses and why he can be the focal point of any offense in the league. He has also developed in the passing game, and if he can continue this, it is difficult to see how the league's defenses will stop him. 1576 yards and 30 Touchdowns in 2024 speaks for itself, which was also rewarded with the title of the league's most valuable player in 2024. 

Center, Joachim Christensen 

The big lineman is by far the Danish player who has had the most success in American football in Europe. Within the league's first three seasons, Joachim Christensen was already accounting for two championships - and even with two different teams. First with Frankfurt Galaxy in the league's debut season and later together with Clark and Toonga in Rhein Fire in 2023. Christensen then stopped his career, but the opportunity at Nordic Storm made the Dane return as an active player and come out of retirement. 

Technical skill combined with aggression is the hallmark of the Dane's playing style, and with his 31 years of age, he also brings an important routine and experience to the new crew, which other more untested teammates can draw on. 

Linebacker, Ludvig Myren 

The Swede, who over the past three seasons has established himself as a big profile in the league with Berlin Thunder, has also made the switch to the new Nordic team. Myren possesses speed and some instincts results in him always being around the ball carrier. He also has a knack for creating turnovers and is even credited with as many as four defensive Touchdowns during his time in the league. He also brings an incredibly passionate mentality when he wreaks havoc on opposition attacks in the middle of his defence. The just 24-year-old Swede was also voted last season's 7th best player, which is by far the highest ranking for a Nordic player in the league's history. 

Cornerback, Exavier Edwards 

Like Clark and Toonga, Edwards has been a profile and a building block of one of the league's strongest teams, the Vienna Vikings. He also chose to switch to the new Nordic team, and here we have a unique player who is incredibly versatile. Not only can he play all positions in the back end of the defence, but his speed, acceleration and change of direction are among the best ever seen in Europe, which is why he has also been used on offense in the past. The former All-Star also has a good habit of taking the ball away from opponents. The 33-year-old American has created a total of 10 turnovers in his total of 24 games. And then he is one of the best returners in the league.

Now it is finally time to find out whether the many impressive and sensational transfers that Nordic Storm has made will bear fruit from the start. Sunday May 18th, the Swiss team Helvetic Mercenaries are ready to welcome the brand new team in the league. A Swiss team which who, after last year's disappointing season with only a single win, has gone through a long list of changes - both on the coaching and player side. They have signed a new head coach, Marcus Herford, who was responsible for a number of great results in the German Football League, with the newly promoted Hildesheim Invaders, who he took to the playoffs. With him, he has brought one of last season's most entertaining and spectacular players in Quarterback Isaiah Weed. Although performances at Cologne Centurions were inconsistent at times, it was clear that when he hit his top level, he was incredibly difficult to stop, even for the best defenses in the league. 

The change in the two most central positions on an American football team clearly shows that the Helvetic Mercenaries have made some drastic changes in order to be more competitive than last year's position as a bottom team, where they also had to see themselves significantly overmatched by the opponent in several games. However, it is clear that there is a lot of untapped potential in the squad, and a lack of top talent is clearly not a problem when the squad is studied closely. The big question is simply whether the depth of the squad is sufficient. 

Helvetic Mercenaries players to watch: 

Quarterback Isaiah Weed: 

The fast American was responsible for great moments of entertainment last season. The highly improvisational style of play combined with a good athletic ability meant that Weed caused several of the league's defenses major problems. While his 2,553 passing yards and 17 passing touchdowns aren't sky-high numbers, they're still impressive when combined with his production in the running game. Here, the 27-year-old Quarterback ran for over 700 yards and added another 8 Touchdowns. 

Wide Receiver Keelan Cole 

Statistically, this is by far the most prominent and successful player to ever be in the league. Keelan Cole was a starter in the NFL for several years, where he managed to catch for almost 3000 yards in the total of six seasons he played in the world's best league. If he plays at this level in ELF, it is by no means unthinkable that Cole will become one of the biggest profiles in the league this year, and a player who can take Mercenaries to new heights. However, he has turned 32 and it has been a few years since he played in the NFL (2022). Is he still the same explosive playmaker? 

Wide Receiver Milan Player: 

Explosiveness and speed characterize the Swiss, who last season was named the best offensive rookie, and was a big bright spot in an otherwise difficult season. He broke the coveted barrier of 1000 yards for a European receiver when he finished with 1008 and 5 Touchdowns. The 21-year-old star, together with 

Cole, will form one of the league's most dangerous duos, and it will be exciting to see if the lightning-quick receiver can raise his level even further. 

Defensive End De'Marco Artis: 

A new player in the ELF, but the American has already shown proof of his level in Europe. In 2023, Artis broke the record for the most sacks in the Finnish league, when he took down the opponent's Quarterback a grand total of 12 times. Before that, he was a standout at West Florida University, and leading up to that he played one year for Baylor University. Together with the very young and talented RJ Sagna on the opposite side, he must try to create pressure on the opponent's Quarterback. 

Cornerback Marko Ilic: 

A little atypically, in this match we find a player on the opponent's team with Danish roots. Instead of trying out for the Storm team, the Danish-Serbian cornerback chose to go to the Helvetic Mercenaries, where he will use his good physique and size to shut down the opponent's best receiver. With a large wingspan and strength, Ilic is a player who can be difficult to get past as a receiver, and if he hits the ground running, he 

is a player who can disrupt the timing between the opponent's quarterback and receivers. 

The match will take place on Sunday at 13:00 and can be seen on DAZN Streaming. Nordic Storm is playing their first home game June 1st at Gladsaxe Stadium, and it is shaping up to be an extraordinary football experience. 

Tickets can be found on Ticketmaster: Nordic Storm Tickets

partsEn.html:
Sunday May 18th, a new chapter in Danish sports history will be written. The high-powered Gladsaxe-based team, Nordic Storm, is playing its first ever match in the European League of Football (ELF). 

Nordic Storm was presented back in September as the newest franchise in the league and since then a lot has happened. First, former NFL coach John Shoop was introduced, and not long after also the league's MVPs (Most Valuable Player) for the 2023 and 2024 seasons, respectively, Quarterback Jadrian Clark and Running Back Glen Toonga. 

And these are just some of the prominent players and coaching names who have joined the Danish-Swedish based team. Several players who have made a name for themselves on the biggest stage in Europe have also joined. No less than nine players on the team have previously been on the league's All Star team over the past four seasons.

Quarterback Jadrian Clark made a bold move together with his Running Back Glen Toonga from Rhein Fire. A very daring and atypical transfer. He had won the two most recent championships, several MVP titles and had gradually become an icon with ELF's strongest team - both on the field and commercially. But instead of continuing in the safe environment, he moved to Copenhagen and signed with the league's newest and unproven addition, Nordic Storm. Here he gives his answers to some of the questions that undeniably follow in the week leading up to the team's first ever game: 

You have Been a part of 3 out the last four ELF finals teams. How do you Think this Nordic Storm team stacks up against the rest of the competition given your past experience with successful teams? 

I’ve been fortunate to be part of some great organizations and championship level teams in the ELF, and I see a lot of similar qualities in this Nordic Storm group. The talent here is undeniable, from the local core to the imports, there’s a high level of athleticism, football IQ, and hunger to compete. What sets successful teams apart isn’t just talent though; it’s the culture, the buy-in, and the daily habits. We’re building that here. It’s early, but if we keep trending in the right direction, there’s no reason this team can’t be right there with the best. 

The talent on the Storm roster is undeniable. But how difficult is it to build chemistry and bring a team together in only two months? (Less than two months for imports) 

It’s definitely a challenge. You’re trying to fast-track relationships and understanding that usually take a whole off-season to build. But the good news is everyone came in with the right mindset. We’re humble, hungry, and willing to put the work in. The staff has also done a great job creating a structure that accelerates that chemistry on and off the field. It’s not perfect yet, but we’re moving fast in the right direction. The key is to keep communicating, keep learning, and trust the process.

The Helvetic Mercenaries are a team that has gone through a lot of changes since last season. How do you see their chances this year and How do you stack up against them in the first game in Nordic Storm history? 

The Mercenaries have had a lot of turnover, but that can be a double-edged sword — sometimes it injects new energy and creates a fresh start. They’ve added some real talent and have playmakers on both sides of the ball, so we’re not taking them lightly at all. That said, we’re focused on us. It’s a big moment, the first game in Storm history. We’re approaching it like we want to set the tone for who we are as a team. It’s about execution, discipline, and playing for each other. If we do that, I like our chances.
