vD3IOpKwl5Zf60yLOjYC.descriptionEn: Nordic Storm has secured its first Head Coach, selecting 55-year-old John Shoop, who has signed a 2-year contract.
vD3IOpKwl5Zf60yLOjYC.titleEn: Nordic American Football Team sign Head Coach

partsEn.html:
Nordic Storm has secured its first Head Coach, selecting 55-year-old John Shoop, who has signed a 2-year contract.

It will be led by the highly experienced John Shoop as Head Coach when the new Danish-Swedish team, Nordic Storm, takes the field for the first time in the top European American football league, the European League of Football (ELF).

John Shoop is a recognized name in American football and comes to Nordic Storm from the German powerhouse Rhein Fire, which has won the league for the past two seasons.

Shoop has operated at the highest level for 33 years and has been highly praised for his work. He has served as Offensive Coordinator and Quarterback Coach for the NFL team Chicago Bears, as well as Quarterback Coach for the NFL teams Oakland Raiders and Tampa Bay Buccaneers. Additionally, he has coached at U.S. universities, such as North Carolina and Purdue.


General Manager of Nordic Storm, Palle Navntoft Christensen, is thrilled about the appointment.


“We are incredibly pleased to have John Shoop leading the team. Building a playoff team from scratch is a unique challenge. John Shoop brings a wealth of experience and has achieved impressive results in ELF, NFL, and college football. He has taken the best from all these worlds. He has a clear vision of what he wants, and he joins us with solid experience and, not least, a hunger to create a Nordic team that can challenge the best teams in Europe,” says Palle Navntoft Christensen.


The Team is Now Being Assembled


The team aims to become a regular contender in the ELF playoffs by 2030. Nordic Storm will consist of top players mainly from Denmark and Sweden, supplemented by experienced NFL coaches and standout players from the ELF.


The team will be selected gradually, leading up to March 2025.


“Nordic Storm is an ambitious team representing the Nordic countries. And with good reason, since many talented players have emerged from Scandinavia in recent years and are now playing at the highest level. Now we will create a European powerhouse. There's a lot of work ahead of us. We want to build something special here, something that players and fans across the Nordic countries can be proud of,” says the new Head Coach.


Countdown to Kickoff


While John Shoop is working on assembling the team, the organization behind Nordic Storm is preparing for its debut in June 2025.


The goal is to make the games at Gladsaxe Stadium not only sporting highlights but also major entertainment events. Investor and board member Lars Green elaborates:


“Every American football game is a celebration. More and more people have recognized this, and the sport has grown rapidly in Europe in recent years. We are now making an effort to create that special atmosphere here in Scandinavia. We aim to build a culture and community around the sport here in the Nordic countries, as has been successfully done in countries like Germany.”


John Shoop started on October 1, 2024, on a 2-year contract.

parts.html:
Nordic Storm har fået sin første Head Coach på plads. Valget er faldet på 55-årige John Shoop, som har fået en 2-årig kontrakt.

Det bliver med den meget erfarne John Shoop som Head Coach, når det nye dansk-svenske hold Nordic Storm for første gang løber ind på banen til en kamp i den bedste europæiske liga i amerikansk fodbold, European League of Football (ELF).

John Shoop er et anerkendt navn inden for amerikansk fodbold og kommer til Nordic Storm fra det tyske storhold Rhein Fire, der har vundet ligaen de seneste to sæsoner.

Shoop har fungeret på topplan i 33 år, og han har modtaget stor hæder sit arbejde. Blandt som offensiv koordinator og Quarterback-coach hos NFL-holdet Chicago Bears, samt Quarterback-coach hos NFL holdene Oakland Raiders og Tampa Bay Buccaneers. Derudover Coach på de amerikanske universiteter North Carolina og Purdue.


General Manager hos Nordic Storm Palle Navntoft Christensen glæder sig over ansættelsen.


”Vi er enormt glade for, at vi har fået John Shoop til at stå i spidsen for holdet. At bygge et playoff-hold fra bunden er en helt særlig udfordring. John Shoop har en bred erfaring og opnået flotte resultater i ELF, NFL og college football. Han har fået det bedste med fra alle verdener. Han har en klar idé om, hvad det er han vil, og han kommer til os med en solid erfaring og ikke mindst en sult efter at skabe et nordisk hold, der kan udfordre de bedste i Europa,” siger Palle Navntoft Christensen.


Holdet skal nu sammensættes


Holdets målsætning er at blive en fast del af ELF's slutspil inden 2030. Nordic Storm kommer til at bestå af de bedste spillere fra primært Danmark og Sverige. Holdet vil også blive suppleret med erfarne Coaches fra NFL og spillerprofiler fra ELF.


Holdet vil løbende blive udtaget frem mod marts 2025.


”Nordic Storm er et ambitiøst hold på Nordens vegne. Og med god grund, for der er kommet mange dygtige spillere herfra de seneste år, som i dag spiller på højeste niveau. Nu skal vi lave et europæisk storhold. Der ligger et stort arbejde foran os. Vi vil opbygge noget særligt her, noget som spillere og fans i hele norden kan være stolte af,” siger den nye Head Coach.


Nedtælling til kickoff


Mens John Shoop arbejder på at sammensætte holdet, forbereder organisationen bag Nordic Storm sig på den historiske debut i juni 2025.


Målet er at gøre kampene på Gladsaxe Stadion til ikke kun sportslige højdepunkter, men også store underholdningsbegivenheder. Investor og bestyrelsesmedlem Lars Green uddyber:


”Hver kamp i amerikansk fodbold er en festlig begivenhed. Det har flere og flere fået øjnene op for, og sporten er derfor vokset hurtigt i Europa de seneste år. Nu gør vi en indsats for at skabe den helt særlige stemning på vores nordlige breddegrader. Vi vil opbygge en kultur og et fællesskab omkring sporten her i Norden, som man med succes har gjort i lande som Tyskland.”


John Shoop startede den 1. oktober 2024 - på en 2-årig kontrakt

wch9DsNAEwOBlDxV7zZ5.title: Brandon Noble præsenteret som ny defensiv koordinator
wch9DsNAEwOBlDxV7zZ5.titleEn: Brandon Noble Introduced as New Defensive Coordinator

parts.html:
Det nye skandinaviske ELF-hold i København, Nordic Storm, har annonceret ansættelsen af Brandon Noble som defensive koordinator. Noble, som bringer en solid baggrund både som spiller og træner, er klar til at dele sin ekspertise og passion for at opbygge en formidabel defensiv i Nordic Storm.

“Jeg har aldrig været mere spændt på en udfordring, end jeg er nu med Nordic Storm. Fra mine dage på Penn State til 9 år i NFL, ved jeg, hvad der skal til for at bygge noget specielt, og det er præcis, hvad vi gør her i København. Denne franchise har potentiale til at elektrificere hele Skandinavien! Vores mission er at bygge et hold, der repræsenterer Nordens hårdhed, sammenhold og ånd. Vi skaber en kultur for excellence, hvor vores spillere vil give alt, hvad de har, for holdet og for fansene. Det handler om at dominere linjen og arbejde som en sammenhængende enhed. Jeg kan ikke vente med at se denne energi komme til live på kampdagen. Med vores fans' brøl bag os, vil Nordic Storm skabe bølger i ELF. Dette er kun begyndelsen!”

Nobles baggrund er dybt rodfæstet i fodbold, da han har tilbragt størstedelen af sit liv på banen. Han delte,

“Jeg har været på fodboldbanen det meste af mit liv, 38 af mine 50 år på jorden er gået med at spille eller træne fodbold. Jeg spillede defensiv tackle på Penn State University i midten af 90'erne og tilbragte derefter 9 år i NFL. To practice squad-forløb med 49ers, to sæsoner i NFL Europe med Barcelona Dragons, derefter 4 år i Dallas og 3 sæsoner i Washington, før jeg gik på pension. Siden da har jeg trænet fodbold, lige fra at træne min søns ungdoms- og high school-hold til 8 år som college-fodboldtræner og 3 sæsoner i professionelle forårsligaer. Sidste sæson var jeg defensiv koordinator i Hamburg for Sea Devils.”

Når det kommer til hans filosofi om forsvar, er Noble klar: han agter at gøre Nordic Storm til en defensiv magtfaktor. Han forklarer,

“Vi vil maksimere vores talent på forsvaret, og mit job er at bygge og implementere et simpelt og aggressivt forsvarssystem, der giver vores spillere mulighed for at spille med overvældende fart og styrke. Vi skal sørge for, at vi forbedrer os en smule, mentalt og fysisk, hver gang vi træder på fodboldbanen eller sætter os til et møde. Vores opgave er at hjælpe vores spillere med at blive bedre til de små ting i løbet af ugen, som samlet set vil skabe en stor defensiv enhed på kampdagen.”

Med et stærkt fundament, en klar mission og en erfaren leder ved roret sætter Nordic Storm og Brandon Noble scenen for en elektrisk tilstedeværelse i European League of Football.

partsEn.html:
The new Scandinavian ELF team in Copenhagen, Nordic Storm, has announced the appointment of Brandon Noble as defensive coordinator. Noble, who brings a wealth of experience both as a player and a coach, is poised to bring his expertise and passion to the Nordic Storm, shaping a formidable defensive lineup.

“I’ve never been more excited about a challenge than I am now with the Nordic Storm. From my days at Penn State to 9 years in the NFL, I know what it takes to build something special, and that’s exactly what we’re doing here in Copenhagen. This franchise has the potential to electrify all of Scandinavia! Our mission is to build a team that embodies the toughness, unity, and spirit of the North. We’re creating a culture of excellence, where our players will give everything, they’ve got for this team and for the fans. It’s about dominating the line of scrimmage and working as one cohesive unit. I can’t wait to see this energy come to life on game day. With the roar of our fans behind us, Nordic Storm is going to make waves in the ELF. This is just the beginning!”

Noble’s background is steeped in football, having spent the majority of his life on the field. He shared,

“I have been on the football field for most of my life, 38 of my 50 years on earth have been spent playing or coaching football. I played defensive tackle at Penn State University in the mid-90s, then spent 9 years in the NFL. Two practice squad stints with the 49ers, two seasons in NFL Europe with the Barcelona Dragons, then 4 years in Dallas, and 3 seasons in Washington before retiring. Since then I have been coaching football, from coaching my son's youth and high school teams, to 8 years as a college football and 3 seasons in professional spring leagues. Last season I was the Defensive Coordinator in Hamburg, for the Sea Devils.”

When it comes to his philosophy on defense, Noble is clear: he intends to make Nordic Storm a defensive powerhouse. He explains,

“We want to maximize our talent on defense, my job is to build and implement a simple and aggressive defensive system that allows our guys to play with overwhelming speed and violence. Making sure we are improving a little bit, mentally and physically, every time we step on the football field or sit down in a meeting. Our job is to help our individual players get better at the little things during the week that will add up to being a great defensive unit on game day.”

With a strong foundation, a clear mission, and an experienced leader at the helm, Nordic Storm and Brandon Noble are setting the stage for an electrifying presence in the European League of Football.

z61vnwyp26mNCOQPzkat.titleEn: Nordic Storm Bolster Roster with Homegrown Talent Ahead of ELF Debut Against Helvetic Mercenaries

parts.imageText: Flere underskrifter er sat forud for 2025 debut kampen
parts.imageTextEn: Multiple signings made ahead of 2025 opener

parts.htmlEn:
As the 2025 European League of Football (ELF) season kicks off this weekend, Denmark and Sweden’s joint franchise, the Nordic Storm, are making waves with a flurry of homegrown signings ahead of their inaugural matchup against the Helvetic Mercenaries on May 18.

The team has strategically bolstered both sides of the ball by signing a core of Danish and Swedish players—many of whom bring ELF experience, national team accolades, and proven talent from top-level domestic leagues.

ELF Veterans Lead the Way

One of the marquee signings is Swedish wide receiver Theodor Landström, who returns to the ELF after stints with the Barcelona Dragons and Hamburg Sea Devils. Landström, 26, exploded onto the scene in 2023, posting 805 yards and eight touchdowns in just 12 games for the Dragons. Known for his smooth route-running and reliable hands, he’s expected to become a go-to weapon for Storm quarterback Jadrian Clark.

Defensive end Emil Hovde, another major acquisition, adds veteran presence to the defensive line. The former Berlin Thunder starter amassed 85 tackles, 19.5 tackles for loss, and 11.5 sacks across two seasons. With previous NCAA Division I experience at Mercer University, Hovde will team up with former Rhein Fire standout Max Parkinson to form a potentially dominant pass-rushing duo.

On the offensive line, the Storm added Swedish tackle Ludvig Burell, who describes himself as a “big and athletic” blocker, capable in both the pass and run game. Burell’s agility and strength will be key in protecting Clark and opening lanes for the run game.

Scandinavian Core Sets the Identity

Complementing the headline signings, Nordic Storm have assembled a deep roster of local Danish and Swedish talent, underlining their commitment to building a truly Scandinavian team.

On offense, the line is anchored by Danish veterans Mikkel Hansen (former Triangle Razorbacks) and Nicholas Møller-Hansen, who joins after playing in Germany’s top league for Kiel. Swedish offensive lineman Elliot Heijmer also joins the unit, bringing raw athleticism and a drive to constantly improve.

In the backfield, Danish running back Anton Witmeur—known for his explosive plays with the Copenhagen Towers and the national team—brings both versatility and scoring potential. Meanwhile, Julius Eriksen, who has suited up for both the Frederikssund Oaks and Aarhus Tigers, will handle kicking duties after years of experience in and outside the Danish borders.

The defense also features local strength, including Danish lineman Joachim Heidelbach (Copenhagen Towers), linebacker Kristoffer Richoff Jensen (Solrød Gold Diggers), and defensive back Jakob Bækgaard, another standout who made the leap from Germany’s Kiel franchise. Together with Sweden’s Hovde, they form the foundation of what the team hopes will be a fast, physical, and fundamentally sound defense.

With a roster blending high-level ELF experience and passionate homegrown players, Nordic Storm enters the 2025 season with both regional pride and serious competitive ambition.
parts.html:
Når sæsonen i European League of Football (ELF) sparkes i gang denne weekend, er det med et nyt skandinavisk islæt i ligaen. Det dansk-svenske ELF-hold Nordic Storm har offentliggjort en række markante signinger af hjemlige profiler forud for holdets debutkamp den 18. maj mod Helvetic Mercenaries.

Truppen er blevet forstærket med både danske og svenske spillere – flere med erfaring fra ELF, nationale landshold og de bedste ligaer i Skandinavien og Tyskland.

ELF-profiler i front

Blandt de største navne finder vi den svenske wide receiver Theodor Landström, som vender tilbage til ELF efter flotte sæsoner hos både Barcelona Dragons og Hamburg Sea Devils. I 2023 greb han 805 yards og 8 touchdowns på 12 kampe for Dragons og etablerede sig som en sikker starter. Landström forventes at blive en vigtig brik i kastespillet hos Nordic Storms quarterback Jadrian Clark.

En anden vigtig forstærkning er defensive end Emil Hovde, som tidligere har spillet to sæsoner hos Berlin Thunder, hvor han lavede 85 tacklinger, heraf 19,5 for tab og 11,5 sacks. Den tidligere Mercer University-spiller (NCAA Division I) vil sammen med tidligere Rhein Fire-spiller Max Parkinson være en nøglespiller på den defensive linje.

På den offensive linje tilføjes yderligere styrke i form af svenske Ludvig Burell, en stor og atletisk tackle, som er stærk i både løbespillet og pass protection.

Skandinavisk kerne sætter retning

Udover profiler med ELF-erfaring, har Nordic Storm også satset tungt på lokalt talent fra både Danmark og Sverige – en klar strategi om at bygge et hold med en skandinavisk identitet.

På den offensive linje er danskeren Mikkel Hansen (tidligere Triangle Razorbacks) hentet ind som center, sammen med Nicholas Møller-Hansen, der kommer fra tyske Kiel. Svenske Elliot Heijmer tilføjes også med en stærk indstilling og lyst til at udvikle sig.

I backfielden får Storm tilført eksplosivitet i form af Anton Witmeur, som mange danske fans kender fra Copenhagen Towers og det danske landshold. Witmeur er en alsidig running back med næse for at ende i modstanderens endzone.

Julius Eriksen, som har sparket for både Frederikssund Oaks og Aarhus Tigers, samt på diverse danske landshold, vil tage sig af special teams som kicker.

I forsvaret er der også masser af dansk islæt. Joachim Heidelbach (Copenhagen Towers) og Kristoffer Richoff Jensen (Solrød Gold Diggers) tilføjer fysik og erfaring fra den hjemlige liga og landsholdet, mens Jakob Bækgaard, som også har spillet for Kiel i Tyskland, tilføjer kvalitet i secondaryen. Sammen med svenske Hovde skal de være med til at skabe en hårdtslående og teknisk stærk defensiv enhed.

Med en blanding af ELF-erfaring og passioneret hjemligt talent, går Nordic Storm ind til 2025-sæsonen med både stolthed og ambitioner på vegne af skandinavisk amerikansk fodbold.
